result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander I Siniard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus costs, surcharges and fees, DNA surcharge.  Bail to apply.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Wisconsin Substance Abuse programs.  The Court is to be notified after 30 days of completion.  Once Court is notified and approval is granted, defendant can be released and remaining incarceration balance can be added to Extended supervision time.

superMiscConds.notes: Inform any and all medical personnel of drug addiction.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Absolute sobriety.   Urine screens to ensure compliance.    No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes: From today's date with $60.00 reinstatement fee.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety plan signed and filed.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also his voting rigths are suspended and may  not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised defendant he will have to provide a DNA sample to the  Wisconsin State Crime Labororaty for DNA testing,  pay DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander I Siniard
